issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: add configuration methods to handle human readable size values

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.summary: Change defaults in hdfs-site.xml to match timeunit type

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
We support human readable units now. The default balancing bandwidth in the conf is "10m". However, human readable units are not supported by dfsadmin -setBalancerBandwidth. This means you can't pass the output of "hdfs getconf -confKey dfs.datanode.balance.bandwidthPerSec" to "hdfs dfsadmin -setBalancerBandwidth".

This is a regression from pre-human readable units.
fields.summary: Accept human-friendly units in dfsadmin -setBalancerBandwidth and -setQuota

This message was automatically generated.

Thanks Andrew for the report and fix. Good to be more human friendly! :)
Nits:
- Why do we need to create a new minicluster? Seems the test suite already sets up one.
- I see there's 1 more {{parseLong}} in {{SetQuotaCommand}}. We can fix here when you're at it, or create a new jira - either way WFM.

Also, should we link this jira to the human readable units?
Thanks for the review Xiao! New patch attached that addresses your review comments.
